thread.title: Telecom Digicel relaunches mobile money product in Haiti
thread.title_full: Telecom Digicel relaunches mobile money product in Haiti

title: Telecom Digicel relaunches mobile money product in Haiti
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Aug 18, 2015, 23:07 BST - UK Markets closed Telecom Digicel relaunches mobile money product in Haiti Telecom relaunches mobile money product in Haiti, where most people don't have bank accounts Associated Press – 1 hour 22 minutes ago Print 
PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) -- A telecommunications company has relaunched a money-transfer system in Haiti that lets people get easier access to cash through their cellphones. 
Digicel says its rebranded "Mon Cash" service has a place in impoverished Haiti, a country where only about 16 percent of the people have bank accounts. 
The telecom says the new mobile money product gives customers the ability to make domestic money transfers, pay bills and perform other basic transactions with their cellphones. 
In a Tuesday statement, Digicel says the relaunched effort has more vendors and a much broader reach than a previous one called "TchoTcho." Opening an account is free and people need only a valid government ID to register. 
Mobile money-transfer systems are also popular in countries such as Kenya, Uganda and the Philippines. Follow the quotes you care about most. Access timely news and investment updates to stay on top of the market. … More » Yahoo UK & Ireland Finance Terms
